title: The Judicial Branch
subtle:
Informational (nonfiction), 1,326 words, Level V (Grade 4), Lexile 940L            
                        
		Multilevel Book also available in levels                     N and Z1
description: The judicial branch, founded by the U.S. Constitution, manages the country's court system, interprets its laws, and protects the rights of its people. Its judges, including the Supreme Court justices, review legal cases and make sure that true justice is done. As one of the three branches of the federal government, the judicial branch helps establish a balance of power in the United States.
highFrequencyWords: Use of vocabulary lessons requires a subscription to VocabularyA-Z.com.
